channel.title: Format

item.title: Format
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

First. Looks much cleaner and uses less lines imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Format
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:4, topic:137595”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=188990.msg1711325#msg1711325 date=1188367551]

i call the second style, “Moparscape Style”.

Moparscape style is a bit different:

public class HelloWorld { //the main void public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, world!); System.exit(-1); //anticrash } }

Hehe.

I like the second one better. Honestly, it’s much cleaner and easier to follow. Just think about it!
[/quote]
how is it cleaner? with the braces on the next line, you dont instantly see where it originated.[/quote]

Meh, probably because I switched from VB7 to Java (Never going back!), I’m just so used to it that way.

Also, with the brackets in the second way, you can see a “tree” more easily if you do your indentation properly. I just think it’s easier to follow if you do it in an IDE where it auto-indents your text.

Read full topic

item.title: Format
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:15, topic:137423”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=188990.msg1708205#msg1708205 date=1188265822]
i call the second style, “Moparscape Style”.
[/quote]
Moparscape style is a bit different:

public class HelloWorld { //the main void public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, world!); System.exit(-1); //anticrash } }[/quote]

Hehe.

I like the second one better. Honestly, it’s much cleaner and easier to follow. Just think about it!

Read full topic
